Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

:v: jcommelin can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9317373066/job/25647529639)

Thanks!

bors d+
Just some initial remarks; I'll look again tomorrow.

Thanks!

bors d+

**[lint-bib]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion @Article{ dieudonne1953, ```

**[lint-bib]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion url = {https://doi.org/10.2307/2031832} ```

```suggestion
    B.orthogonal ⊤ = ⊥ :=
  (Submodule.eq_bot_iff _).mpr fun _ hx ↦ hB _ fun y ↦ hB₀ _ _ <| hx y Submodule.mem_top
```

```suggestion
    ∀ N : LieSubmodule K L V, N ≠ ⊥ → ∃ a : LieSubmodule K L V, IsAtom a ∧ a ≤ N := by
```

I cringe slightly at my words of 2021. How about just:
```suggestion
In this file we define simple and semisimple Lie algebras, together with related concepts.
```

I think I'd drop this instance now (even though it's technically slightly stronger than our results over fields)
```suggestion
```
I actually think we should keep it! Even though we don't have a use in the near future, you never know...

I think we should add:
```suggestion

lemma _root_.LinearMap.BilinForm.lieInvariant_iff [LieModule R L M] :
    Φ.lieInvariant (L := L) ↔ ∀ x : L, ⁅x, Φ⁆ = 0 := by
  refine ⟨fun h x ↦ ?_, fun h x y z ↦ ?_⟩
  · ext y z
    rw [LieHom.lie_apply, LinearMap.sub_apply, Module.Dual.lie_apply, LinearMap.zero_apply,
      LinearMap.zero_apply, h, sub_self]
  · replace h := LinearMap.congr_fun₂ (h x) y z
    simp only [LieHom.lie_apply, LinearMap.sub_apply, Module.Dual.lie_apply,
      LinearMap.zero_apply, sub_eq_zero] at h
    simp [← h]

```
(which justifies the name "invariant").

Arguably this should even be the definition (though because of the way I have set up the type instances, we would then pick up a redundant `[LieModule R L M]`).

Rereading this now, I think better would be:
```suggestion
    Φ.lieInvariant L ↔ Φ ∈ LieModule.maxTrivSubmodule R L (LinearMap.BilinForm R M) := by
```
which makes me realise that we should probably rename `maxTrivSubmodule` to `invariantSubmodule`.

The condition of having only non-Abelian atoms is coming up repeatedly. What do you think about introducing:
```lean
class LieAlgebra.HasNonAbelianAtoms (R L : Type*)
    [CommRing R] [LieRing L] [LieAlgebra R L] : Prop :=
  non_abelian_of_isAtom : ∀ I : LieIdeal R L, IsAtom I → ¬ IsLieAbelian I
```
which `IsSemisimple` would then extend.

Admittedly the lemma below is a result about a single atomic non-Abelian Lie ideal rather than about Lie algebras in which all atomic ideals are non-Abelian but if we care about this, we could keep this lemma unchanged and have a corollary stated using `HasNonAbelianAtoms` for downstream convenience.
I would prefer to do this in a follow-up PR.

The naming is only OK if we have a definition if perfect Lie algebras. Probably we should introduce a class for this too, right?
```suggestion
lemma perfect_of_isAtom_of_nonabelian {R L : Type*} [CommRing R] [LieRing L] [LieAlgebra R L]
```
Agreed. I have renamed to `lie_eq_self` and added a TODO that we should add perfect Lie algebras. But I would prefer to defer that TODO to a later PR.

Nit:
```suggestion
  · contrapose! h
    rw [LieSubmodule.lie_eq_bot_iff] at h
    constructor
    simpa only [LieIdeal.coe_bracket_of_module, Subtype.ext_iff, LieSubmodule.coe_bracket,
      ZeroMemClass.coe_zero, Subtype.forall, LieSubmodule.mem_coeSubmodule] using h
```

```suggestion
These ideals are simple Lie algebras, by `LieAlgebra.IsSemisimple.isSimple_of_isAtom`.
```
Just noting this hypothesis could become `[HasNonAbelianAtoms R L]`

```suggestion
  suffices ¬I ≤ orthogonal Φ hΦ_inv I by simpa
```
I haven't looked closely but this is surely a result about upgrading `Disjoint` to `IsCompl` for reflexive bilinear forms? Should we just add that lemma?
Good point, I've refactored this, and pulled it into a separate PR.

This can be:
```suggestion
  rw [isCompl_iff, LieSubmodule.disjoint_iff_coe_toSubmodule,
    LieSubmodule.codisjoint_iff_coe_toSubmodule, ← isCompl_iff]
  exact orthogonal_isCompl_submodule Φ hΦ_nondeg hΦ_inv hΦ_refl hL I hI
```
but what this really should is that we should add the missing lemma `LieSubmodule.isCompl_iff_coe_toSubmodule` just below `LieSubmodule.codisjoint_iff_coe_toSubmodule`, and then this is a one-liner
good point. done

```suggestion
over fields with positive characteristic.

Note that when the coefficients are a field this instance is redundant since we have
`LieAlgebra.IsKilling.instSemisimple` and `LieAlgebra.IsSemisimple.instHasTrivialRadical`. -/
```

This is just:
```suggestion
lemma killingForm_lieInvariant : (killingForm R L).lieInvariant L :=
  LieModule.traceForm_apply_lie_apply' R L L
```
Probably we should just have `tracefForm_lieInvariant` next to `LieModule.traceForm_apply_lie_apply'` instead.

nodes.title: A semisimple Lie algebra is a direct sum of simple Lie algebras

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Lie): Killing Lie algebras are semisimple

nodes.body: Just some initial remarks; I'll look again tomorrow.

[Merged by Bors] - chore(Algebra/Lie/Abelian): a nonabelian atomic Lie ideal is perfect
